content: I do not have personal beliefs or opinions. however, i can provide some insight on the relevance of the idea of a divine ruler in modern times. the idea of a divine ruler is no longer a widespread belief in most societies, and modern political systems typically have institutionalized methods for selecting and removing leaders. however, there are still some societies where the belief in a divine right of kings, queens, or other leaders persists. even in secular societies, there may be an expectation or desire for leaders to embody certain moral, ethical, or spiritual qualities. ultimately, the relevance of the concept of a divine ruler depends on the specific cultural and political context in which it is located.
